Usain Bolt.passage: Usain Bolt (born 21 August 1986) is a Jamaican retired sprinter. He is widely considered the fastest person of all time. He won eight Olympic gold medals and achieved world records in all of the events he contested. He is the first man to hold both the 100 metres and 200 metres world records since fully automatic time measurements became mandatory in 1977. Along with his teammates, he also set the world record in the 4 × 100 metres relay. He was the first person to win gold in the 100 metres, 200 metres and 4 × 100 metres relay at three different Olympics (2008, 2012 and 2016). Bolt is the only sprinter to win gold in all three events at consecutive Olympics (2008 and 2012). He is the most successful athlete of the World Championships, winning 11 gold medals, the most by any athlete in the history of the championships. Bolt is also the first athlete to win three gold medals in the 100 metres, 200 metres and 4 × 100 metres relay at the World Championships. He is widely considered to be the greatest sprinter of all time.

WTA.passage: Women's Tennis Association (WTA) is the principal organizing body of women's professional tennis. Madeira.passage: Madeira is a Portuguese archipelago located in the north Atlantic Ocean, southwest of Portugal. It is composed of two main islands, Madeira and Porto Santo, and two smaller islands, Desertas and Selvagens. The archipelago is known for its mild subtropical climate, exceptional flora and fauna, and its unique cultural heritage. The capital of Madeira is Funchal, which is also the largest city in the archipelago. The island is a popular tourist destination, with its rugged coastline, volcanic landscapes, and lush green forests. The island is also famous for its Madeira wine, which is produced in the region using traditional methods. The wine is made from a variety of grapes, including Tinta Negra, Verdelho, and Boal. The island is also known for its traditional music and dance, which is influenced by African and European cultures. The archipelago is a popular destination for hiking, diving, and other outdoor activities.

qae_pairs.explanation: The wine is made from a variety of grapes, including Tinta Negra, Verdelho, and Boal.

The club has won a record 33 La Liga titles, 11 UEFA Champions League titles, and 4 FIFA Club World Cup titles. Real Madrid has a long-standing rivalry with FC Barcelona, known as El Clásico. Ohio.passage: Ohio is a state in the Great Lakes region of the United States. It is the 34th largest by area, the 7th most populous, and the 10th most densely populated of the 50 United States. The state's capital and largest city is Columbus. The Anglicized name "Ohio" comes from the Iroquois word ohi-yo’, meaning "great river" or "large creek". The state, originally partitioned from the Northwest Territory, was admitted to the Union as the 17th state on March 1, 1803. Ohio is an industrial state, with a diverse economy that includes aerospace, automotive, and technology among others. The state is also known for its agriculture, which includes corn, soybeans, and wheat among others. Ohio has a diverse geography, with the flat central Ohio River Valley, the hilly eastern foothills of the Appalachian Mountains, and the northern shore of Lake Erie. The state is also home to several major sports teams, including the Cleveland Browns, Cincinnati Bengals, and the Ohio State Buckeyes.

Columbus.passage: Columbus was an Italian explorer, navigator, and colonizer who completed four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean under the sponsorship of the Catholic Monarchs of Spain. He led the first European expeditions to the Caribbean, Central America, and South America, encountering the indigenous American peoples and initiating European colonization of the Americas. His voyages initiated the Spanish colonization of the Americas and the transatlantic slave trade. Columbus's early life is somewhat unclear, but he was born in the Republic of Genoa, in modern-day Italy, to a family of wool weavers. He worked as a seaman and later became a merchant, sailing along the coasts of Europe and Africa. In 1485, he married Felipa Moniz, the daughter of a wool merchant from the port of Lisbon, Portugal. In 1492, Columbus received royal support from Queen Isabella I of Castile and King Ferdinand II of Aragon, who provided him with three ships and a crew of 90 men for his first voyage. He departed from Palos, Spain, on August 3, 1492, and sailed westward across the Atlantic Ocean. After a month-long voyage, he landed on the island of San Salvador in the Bahamas on October 12, 1492, which he claimed for Spain. Columbus went on to make three more voyages to the Americas, each time sailing farther south along the coast of Central and South America. He explored the Orinoco River in Venezuela and the Amazon River in Brazil, and he believed he had reached the East Indies.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the port from which Columbus's wife, Felipa Moniz, came from?
qae_pairs.explanation: In 1485, he married Felipa Moniz, the daughter of a wool merchant from the port of Lisbon, Portugal.

Michigan.passage: Michigan is a state in the Great Lakes region of the Midwestern United States. It is the tenth most populous of the 50 United States, with the 11th most extensive total area. Michigan is the only state to consist entirely of two peninsulas. The Lower Peninsula, to which the name Michigan was originally applied, is often dubbed "the mitten" by residents, owing to its shape. The Upper Peninsula is separated from the Lower Peninsula by the Straits of Mackinac, a five-mile-wide (8 km) channel that joins Lake Huron to Lake Michigan. The state has the longest freshwater coastline of any political subdivision in the world, being bounded by four of the five Great Lakes, plus Lake Saint Clair. Michigan is one of the most diverse states in the country, with abundant natural resources, a strong economy, and a thriving arts and culture scene.

Draft.passage: Draft is a term used in various sports, including American football, association football, basketball, and ice hockey, to describe a set of rules or procedures that govern the selection of players or teams for a competition. In American football, for example, the draft is an annual event in which National Football League (NFL) teams take turns selecting amateur college players who they believe will contribute to their team's success. The draft typically takes place in April, with the order of selection determined by the previous season's standings. In association football, the draft is used to assign players to teams in leagues where teams do not have exclusive control over their players' rights. In basketball, the draft is used to assign players to teams in the National Basketball Association (NBA) and the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA). In ice hockey, the draft is used to assign players to teams in the National Hockey League (NHL) and the Canadian Hockey League (CHL).

the New England Patriots.passage: The New England Patriots are a professional American football team based in the Greater Boston region. The Patriots compete in the National Football League (NFL) as a member club of the league's American Football Conference (AFC) East division. The team plays its home games at Gillette Stadium in the town of Foxborough, Massachusetts, which is located 21 miles (34 km) southwest of downtown Boston. The Patriots were founded in 1960 as the Boston Patriots, one of the eight teams that joined the American Football League (AFL) in its inaugural season. The team changed its name to the New England Patriots in 1971, when it moved to Foxborough and began playing its home games at Schaefer Stadium. The Patriots were one of three AFL teams that joined the NFL in the 1970 merger of the two leagues. The Patriots have appeared in nine Super Bowls, winning six of them. They have won 14 division championships, 18 conference championships, and have the second-best overall record in the NFL since 1970. The Patriots have appeared in the playoffs 30 times, and have won 16 division championships in that time. Deflategate.passage: 1. Deflategate is a controversy that erupted in 2015 over allegations that the New England Patriots, an American football team, used underinflated footballs in an American Football Conference (AFC) championship game against the Indianapolis Colts. 2. The controversy began when officials noticed that the Patriots' footballs were significantly deflated during the game, which led to accusations that the team had deliberately tampered with the balls to gain an unfair advantage. 3. The Patriots denied any wrongdoing, but the controversy continued to escalate, with some accusing the team of cheating and others defending them as innocent victims of a witch hunt. 4. Eventually, an investigation by the National Football League (NFL) concluded that it was likely that two Patriots employees had deliberately deflated the balls, but that there was no evidence that the team's coach, Tom Brady, had known about it. 5. Brady was suspended for four games and the team was fined $1 million, but the ruling was later overturned on appeal. 6. The controversy continued to be a topic of debate among sports fans and pundits, with some arguing that the punishment was too harsh and others claiming that the Patriots had cheated and deserved to be punished. 7. Despite the controversy, the Patriots went on to win the Super Bowl that year, further fueling the debate over Deflategate and its impact on the team's success.

Donald Trump.passage: Donald Trump is an American businessman, television personality, and politician who served as the 45th president of the United States from 2017 to 2021. Trump was born and raised in the New York City borough of Queens and received an economics degree from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He then entered the real estate business, eventually establishing himself as a prominent figure in the industry. Trump is also known for his television career, including his role as the host of the reality show The Apprentice. In 2016, Trump launched a successful campaign for the presidency, defeating Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton in the general election. He was inaugurated as president on January 20, 2017, and served until January 20, 2021. During his presidency, Trump pursued a controversial and polarizing agenda, including a hardline stance on immigration, a focus on economic growth and deregulation, and a confrontational approach to foreign policy. He was impeached twice by the United States House of Representatives, but was acquitted both times by the Senate. Trump remains a controversial figure in American politics and is widely recognized as a divisive and polarizing figure.

the United States Soccer Federation.passage: The United States Soccer Federation (USSF) is the official governing body of soccer in the United States. It was founded in 1913 and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of soccer in the country, including the men's, women's, and youth national teams, as well as the development of the sport at the grassroots level. The USSF is a member of both FIFA and CONCACAF, the two international soccer governing bodies. The federation is headquartered in Chicago, Illinois and is made up of representatives from each of the 55 member state associations. The USSF is responsible for organizing and hosting various soccer events, including the men's and women's national soccer cups, the men's and women's national soccer leagues, and the men's and women's national soccer teams. The federation also oversees the development of soccer at the youth level, with programs such as the Development Academy and the Youth National Teams program. The USSF is committed to promoting the growth of soccer in the United States and developing the sport at all levels.

qae_pairs.question: What international soccer governing body is the United States Soccer Federation a member of?
qae_pairs.explanation: The USSF is a member of both FIFA and CONCACAF, the two international soccer governing bodies.

U.S.passage: presidential elections. The United States presidential election of 2020 was the 59th quadrennial presidential election, held on Tuesday, November 3, 2020. The Democratic Party nominee, former Vice President Joe Biden, and his running mate, Senator Kamala Harris of California, defeated the incumbent President Donald Trump, the Republican Party nominee, and his running mate, Governor Mike Pence of Indiana. Biden won a majority of the electoral votes, with 306, while Trump received 232. The election was marked by a historically high voter turnout, with over 159 million people casting ballots, and was closely contested in several battleground states. The election was also notable for the first time that a woman, a person of color, and a member of the LGBTQ+ community were elected to the presidency and vice presidency.

qae_pairs.question: What state did Joe Biden choose as his running mate for the 2020 U.S presidential election?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Democratic Party nominee, former Vice President Joe Biden, and his running mate, Senator Kamala Harris of California, defeated the incumbent President Donald Trump, the Republican Party nominee, and his running mate, Governor Mike Pence of Indiana.

Barcelona.passage: Barcelona is the capital and largest city of the autonomous community of Catalonia in Spain, as well as the second most populous municipality of Spain. It is located on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, between the mouths of the rivers Llobregat and Besòs, and is bounded to the west by the Serra de Collserola mountain range, the tallest peak of which is 512 meters high. Barcelona has a rich cultural heritage and is today an important cultural center and a major tourist destination. It is renowned for its architecture, including works by Antoni Gaudí, such as the Sagrada Família and Park Güell, as well as for its art and museums, gastronomy, and nightlife. The city is also known for its football club, FC Barcelona, which has won many domestic and international titles. Barcelona has a population of 1.6 million people, and its metropolitan area has a population of 3.2 million, making it the sixth most populous urban area in the European Union after Paris, London, Ruhr area, Madrid and Milan. The city is well connected by road, rail, air and sea, with Barcelona-El Prat Airport being one of the largest in Europe in terms of passenger numbers.

Messi.passage: Messi is an Argentine professional footballer who plays as a forward for Spanish club Barcelona and the Argentina national team. He is often considered the best player in the world and is widely regarded as one of the greatest football players of all time. Messi has spent his entire professional career with Barcelona, where he has won a record 34 trophies, including ten La Liga titles, seven Copa del Rey titles, and four UEFA Champions League titles. He has scored over 700 goals for the club, and is the club's all-time leading scorer. Messi has also won a record seven Ballon d'Or awards, four of which he won consecutively from 2009 to 2012. He has won numerous other awards, including the Golden Foot and the Golden Boy award. Messi has represented Argentina in over 140 matches, and has scored over 70 international goals. He has won a record 31 trophies with the national team, including the 2014 FIFA World Cup and the 2015 and 2016 Copa América. Messi is known for his quick dribbling, speed, and ability to score from anywhere on the field. He is also known for his humility and his dedication to his family and friends.
